content:
The lang team is holding the next planning meeting on July 7th (next week), and is looking for updates from the deny semicolons group -- looks like there's not a dedicated stream or tracking issue on lang-team repo, but leaving it on the tracking issue seems good: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/79813

Good questions to consider:

  • What are recent topics of discussion?
  • Any exciting developments since the last check-in?
  • Any points where the group is stuck and the lang-team could weigh in?
  • Any potential design meeting topics?
  • Any other concerns?

No worries if there's not been any significant progress since the last update.

cc @Aaron Hill
I haven't yet managed to get the lint to check for allow/deny attr at the right scope (it currently only works at the enclosing function)
We're now denying the lint within the compiler
I'm going to take another shot a starting a crate run with the lint made into a hard error (there are some compiler deps that need to get bumped)
